meanings.definition: Expected at a certain time or on a certain date.
meanings.sent2: The rent payment is due on the first of the month.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was due to start at 7 pm.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air was due to the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was due to the impending deadline.

meanings.sent1: The due amount must be paid by the end of the week.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't ignore the due bills any longer.
meanings.sent3: The due loan was haunting him in his dreams.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the due debt felt like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The urgency to settle the due balance was palpable.

meanings.sent1: She gave a due explanation for her absence.
meanings.sent2: The due supply of food lasted the entire trip.
meanings.sent3: His due preparation paid off during the exam.
meanings.sent4: The due amount of effort led to success.
meanings.sent5: The due care taken ensured a smooth process.

meanings.sent1: The recognition was due after years of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The punishment was due for the wrongdoing.
meanings.sent3: His due reward was a surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: The due praise lifted his spirits.
meanings.sent5: The due respect was shown to the elder statesman.
